task.title: Lines
task.shortdesc: A line consists of two points: a start point and an endpoint. You can connect a series of lines, but each line segment is considered a separate line object.

step.cmd: Choose Draw > Line from the mainmenu.

Complete the first line segment by specifying the endpoint. To undo the previous line segment during the Line command, enter u (undo) and then press ENTER. Specify the endpoints of any additional line segments.
Press Enter to complete the command.
To start a new line at the endpoint of the last line drawn, start the Line command again and press Enter directlyat the "Specify first point:" prompt.

result.p: If the last object you drew was an arc, you can also draw a line connect to and starting fromthe endpoint of the arc.
To draw a line as a continuation fromthe end of an arc

ol.li: Choose Draw > Line from the mainmenu.
Take the end of an arc as the start point of theline.
Specify the length of the line.

result.p: The endpoint of the previous arc (A) and length of the line (B).
